result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marinette County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs of $908.00, plus DNA surcharge of $250.00, plus service fees of $77.00 totals $1235.00 due $100/mo comm 2-5-2016 or 49 days jail and civil judgment.
Not allowed to possess firearms.  Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.  DNA Sampe to be taken by 12-21-2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M. Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
